content:
Road Transport Legislation Amendment (Post-Crash Drug and Alcohol Testing) Bill 2025 [NSW]
Schedule 1 Amendment of Road Transport Act 2013 No 18
(c) the mandatory interlock order is revoked.
(7) Transport for NSW may, by written notice given to the offender—
(a) nominate a drink driving education program, and
(b) require the offender to undertake the program within the period specified in the notice.
[37] Schedule 1 Examples of statutory rule-making powers
Omit “accidents” from clause 10, heading. Insert instead “**crashes**”.
[38] Schedule 1, clause 10
Omit “an accident”. Insert instead “a crash”.
[39] Schedule 1, clause 10(a) and (b)
Omit “the accident” wherever occurring. Insert instead “the crash”.
[40] Schedule 3 Testing for alcohol and drug use

Omit clause 1(1), definition of **accident**. Insert in alphabetical order—
**alcohol analysis**, of a person’s blood or urine, means an analysis to determine the concentration of alcohol in the person’s blood or urine.
**applicable driver licence** has the same meaning as in Part 5.1.
**attempting to drive a motor vehicle** means occupying the driving seat of a motor vehicle and attempting to put the motor vehicle in motion.
**crash**—
(a) means a crash that—
(i) involves a motor vehicle or other vehicle or a horse, and
(ii) is on a road, and
(b) for clause 12—includes a crash that—
(i) involves a motor vehicle, and
(ii) is not on a road.

**crash hospital patient**, for Schedule 3, Part 2, Division 4—see clause 10.
**crash participant** means a person who—
(a) at the time of a crash, was—
(i) driving a motor vehicle involved in the crash, or
(ii) attempting to drive a motor vehicle involved in the crash, or
(iii) supervising a learner driver who was driving a motor vehicle involved in the crash, or
(iv) riding a bicycle involved in the crash, and
(b) is at least 15 years of age.

**drug** does not include alcohol.
**drug analysis**, of a person’s blood or urine, means an analysis to determine the presence or concentration of a drug in the person’s blood or urine.
**grievous bodily harm** has the same meaning as in the *Crimes Act 1900*.
**hospital**, for Schedule 3, Part 2, Division 4—see clause 10.
**prescribed laboratory**, for Schedule 3, Part 4—see clause 23.
**secondary participant** in a crash means a person involved in the crash who was—
